title.narrative: El pais habra implementado estrategias y politicas para el manejo y uso sustentable de los recursos naturales y ambientales.

description.narrative: Enabling framework in place for up scaling PES geographically throughout Argentina and thematically to other PES schemes
1 Outreach program targeting the whole range of PES stakeholders sellers buyers and provincial governments responsible for oversight and monitoring developed and validated

comment.narrative: Nonexistent
By PY3 outreach program developed

Programs targeting a whole range of PES stakeholders developed and being implemented in the four pilot sites Importance of ES in land use planning and of PES scheme as a conservation tool instaled in the four pilot sites
By PY3 outreach program developed

Programs targeting a whole range of PES stakeholders developed and being implemented in the four pilot sites Importance of ES in land use planning and of PES scheme as a conservation tool instaled in the four pilot sites

description.narrative: 2 Number of dissemination events organized and participants

comment.narrative: Nonexistent
By PY4 at least 10 regional workshops with at least 50 participants per workshop

There have been eight large workshops on ES and PES schemes Chaco 3 Misiones 2 Entre Ríos 2 and Formosa 1 with a total of about 400 participants including landowners policymakers researchers and technical staff from the national and provincial governments There has been also numerous about 25 presentationsradio showsmeetingsconferences about Project objectives and activities directed to a wide range of audiences ie farmers general public researchers policymakers at the local regional national and international level during the reporting period In addition a paper describing the Project experience developing the PES scheme associated with the Forest Conservation Law 26331 in the Chaco Pilot Site has been accepted for publication in the XIV World Forestry Congress to be held in South Africa in September 2015
By PY4 at least 10 regional workshops with at least 50 participants per workshop

There have been eight large workshops on ES and PES schemes Chaco 3 Misiones 2 Entre Ríos 2 and Formosa 1 with a total of about 400 participants including landowners policymakers researchers and technical staff from the national and provincial governments There has been also numerous about 25 presentationsradio showsmeetingsconferences about Project objectives and activities directed to a wide range of audiences ie farmers general public researchers policymakers at the local regional national and international level during the reporting period In addition a paper describing the Project experience developing the PES scheme associated with the Forest Conservation Law 26331 in the Chaco Pilot Site has been accepted for publication in the XIV World Forestry Congress to be held in South Africa in September 2015

description.narrative: 3 Proposal for PES law elaborated and validated with key stakeholders

comment.narrative: Nonexistent

Contacts are maintained with the Chairman of the Agricutural Comission of the National Congress to pursue the idea of a proposal on a PES national law based on project s lessons
By PY4 proposal elaborated and validated
Contacts are maintained with the Chairman of the Agricutural Comission of the National Congress to pursue the idea of a proposal on a PES national law based on project s lessons

description.narrative: 4 Number of potential hectares identified where PES schemes may be applied

comment.narrative: Nonexistent
By PY4 45 million hectares

Number of hectares where PES schemes guidelines developed by the project are in the process of upscaling 7 million Chaco 45 million Entre Ríos 25 million Number of potential hectares where PES scheme in provinces with pilot sites could be applied i Misiones 600000 hectares ii Formosa 35 million hectares
By PY4 45 million hectares

Number of hectares where PES schemes guidelines developed by the project are in the process of upscaling 7 million Chaco 45 million Entre Ríos 25 million Number of potential hectares where PES scheme in provinces with pilot sites could be applied i Misiones 600000 hectares ii Formosa 35 million hectares

description.narrative: Knowhow on effective operational setups for optimizing benefits from existing and potential ES incentives is expanded and reinforced through field demonstrations of different PES schemes
1PES schemes and monitoring mechanisms designed and validated with provincial authorities and local stakeholders

comment.narrative: Existing incentives lack specific mechanisms to implement PES schemes that secure global benefits
By PY1 3 PES schemes under Government incentives Chaco Formosa and Entre Rios and 1 classical PES scheme Jujuy

Four PES schemes are under different stages of implementation in the four pilot sites In Entre Rios all technical and operative aspects for the PES scheme have been completed and jointly developed with provincial authorities The provincial government who is in charge of executing the PES decided that before proceeding to make any compensation under the new compensation scheme it will incorporate the compensation for carbon and biodiversity ES conservation into the body of the Provincial Soil Conservation Law a bill proposal in that direction is currently under discussion in the provincial Legislature In addition 30 farmers are preparing systematization plans for their farms under the Projects approach In Misiones all aspects regarding institutional and administrative arrangements ie contracts administration of funds monitoring and certification of land use plans etc needed to put into place the PES scheme have been completed and validated with key actors such as the Cooperativa de Servicios de Oberá in charge of collecting and disbursing the payments the Municipalities of Oberá and Campo Ramón where beneficiaries are located and the San Ramón Watershed Committee the overseeing institution Although farmers located in critical areas for water services are being capacitated for developing management plans to receive the payment the Cooperative of Oberá has requested to postpone for 2016 the application of the PES scheme in order to adjust water tariffs water tariffs need to be adjusted by 40 to be according to inflation a provision costs before including a charge for ES in the water bill In Chaco and Formosa technical and operative aspects of the PES scheme associated to the National Forest Conservation Law 26331 have been designed by the Project Amounts to be paid by ES are still under discussion among national and provincial authorities under the aegis of the project Although farmers participating in the project elaborated and presented their management plans following the Project PES scheme guidelines at the end of 2014 to receive payment under Law 26331 in 2015 27 in Chaco and 10 in Formosa no payment has been made yet due to differences between national and provincial authorities regarding funds allocation for management plans of fermers participating in the Project
By PY1 3 PES schemes under Government incentives Chaco Formosa and Entre Rios and 1 classical PES scheme Jujuy

Four PES schemes are under different stages of implementation in the four pilot sites In Entre Rios all technical and operative aspects for the PES scheme have been completed and jointly developed with provincial authorities The provincial government who is in charge of executing the PES decided that before proceeding to make any compensation under the new compensation scheme it will incorporate the compensation for carbon and biodiversity ES conservation into the body of the Provincial Soil Conservation Law a bill proposal in that direction is currently under discussion in the provincial Legislature In addition 30 farmers are preparing systematization plans for their farms under the Projects approach In Misiones all aspects regarding institutional and administrative arrangements ie contracts administration of funds monitoring and certification of land use plans etc needed to put into place the PES scheme have been completed and validated with key actors such as the Cooperativa de Servicios de Oberá in charge of collecting and disbursing the payments the Municipalities of Oberá and Campo Ramón where beneficiaries are located and the San Ramón Watershed Committee the overseeing institution Although farmers located in critical areas for water services are being capacitated for developing management plans to receive the payment the Cooperative of Oberá has requested to postpone for 2016 the application of the PES scheme in order to adjust water tariffs water tariffs need to be adjusted by 40 to be according to inflation a provision costs before including a charge for ES in the water bill In Chaco and Formosa technical and operative aspects of the PES scheme associated to the National Forest Conservation Law 26331 have been designed by the Project Amounts to be paid by ES are still under discussion among national and provincial authorities under the aegis of the project Although farmers participating in the project elaborated and presented their management plans following the Project PES scheme guidelines at the end of 2014 to receive payment under Law 26331 in 2015 27 in Chaco and 10 in Formosa no payment has been made yet due to differences between national and provincial authorities regarding funds allocation for management plans of fermers participating in the Project

description.narrative: 5 of producers that stay in the PES scheme

comment.narrative: None
At least 75 by PY4

Seventy percent of landowners from Chaco and Formosa 41 out of 58 have already presented management plans an indirect way to estbalish a legal contract for partcipating in the PES scheme to receive compensation under Forest Conservation Law 26331 and the rest is in the process to do so Landowners from Misiones are being capacitated on PES participation Landowners from Entre Rios are awaiting passing of the bill adopting the new PES scheme to prepare and present thier management plans
At least 75 by PY4

Seventy percent of landowners from Chaco and Formosa 41 out of 58 have already presented management plans an indirect way to estbalish a legal contract for partcipating in the PES scheme to receive compensation under Forest Conservation Law 26331 and the rest is in the process to do so Landowners from Misiones are being capacitated on PES participation Landowners from Entre Rios are awaiting passing of the bill adopting the new PES scheme to prepare and present thier management plans

description.narrative: 7 Costs and benefits of PES schemes assessed

comment.narrative: None
By PY4 costs of sequestration of tC versus costs of sequestration of tC of the alternative

Estimates for the costs of sequestration of tC of the alternative using forest plantations varies between US 1747 and US 2997 without purchasing land and US 2971 and US 4364 with purchasing land depending on the considered discounting and exchanging rates
By PY4 costs of sequestration of tC versus costs of sequestration of tC of the alternative

Estimates for the costs of sequestration of tC of the alternative using forest plantations varies between US 1747 and US 2997 without purchasing land and US 2971 and US 4364 with purchasing land depending on the considered discounting and exchanging rates

description.narrative: Knowledge base on ecosystems services expanded with models and tools to facilitate decision making regarding the tradeoff of different land uses
3 Number of decision makers and technical staff of SAyDS and INTA with capacities strengthened on ES and tradeoffs between ESland uses

comment.narrative: Low levels of training and knowledge on ES
By PY2 at least 25 of the staffs of the substantive areas of SAyDS and INTA s regional units involved in the project

More tan 75 of the substantive staff from SAyDS about 15 personnel and INTA about 40 personnel related to Project topics ie forest soils water biodiversity economics GIS management plan formulation PES design and monitoring are involved in the Poject In addition training to strengthen capacities and knowledge on ES and PES has to continue to different audiences and decisiónmakers In Chaco and Formosa 25 decisiónmakers and technical staff form the provincial government 10 researchers from de regional university and 15 professionals from the private sector were trained on forest management plan design aimed at ES conservation and on ES importance in land planning In Misiones a course on PES oriented to water services was conducted to membersof the San ramón Watershed Committee 27 participants In Entre Ríos two workshops on ES and PES design were offered to 25 personnel from INTA the provincial government and the local university
By PY2 at least 25 of the staffs of the substantive areas of SAyDS and INTA s regional units involved in the project

More tan 75 of the substantive staff from SAyDS about 15 personnel and INTA about 40 personnel related to Project topics ie forest soils water biodiversity economics GIS management plan formulation PES design and monitoring are involved in the Poject In addition training to strengthen capacities and knowledge on ES and PES has to continue to different audiences and decisiónmakers In Chaco and Formosa 25 decisiónmakers and technical staff form the provincial government 10 researchers from de regional university and 15 professionals from the private sector were trained on forest management plan design aimed at ES conservation and on ES importance in land planning In Misiones a course on PES oriented to water services was conducted to membersof the San ramón Watershed Committee 27 participants In Entre Ríos two workshops on ES and PES design were offered to 25 personnel from INTA the provincial government and the local university

description.narrative: 2 Number of models developed to quantify the level of ES per land use relative profitability and economic value

comment.narrative: Nonexistent
By PY1 4 models developed 1 per pilot site

Four GISbased models under different stages of development in the four pilot sites In Chaco model developed and tested for 35 farmers work is underway to extrapolte to the entire pilot site In Formosa model is under development for 23 farmers In Entre Rios model is underway and calibration with the collaboration from governament ofices for the entire pilot site In Misiones model is underway to integrate the different information levels for the entire watershed
By PY1 4 models developed 1 per pilot site

Four GISbased models under different stages of development in the four pilot sites In Chaco model developed and tested for 35 farmers work is underway to extrapolte to the entire pilot site In Formosa model is under development for 23 farmers In Entre Rios model is underway and calibration with the collaboration from governament ofices for the entire pilot site In Misiones model is underway to integrate the different information levels for the entire watershed

description.narrative: Mechanisms for payment for ecosystem services ES are tested and replication systems developed to ensure the protection of natural ecosystems of Argentina and the services provided by these

2 Number of hectares identified with conditions for replication upon project termination
a In pilot provinces
b Outside project area

comment.narrative: a In pilot Provinces Chaco 45 million ha of forests Formosa 35 million ha of forests Entre Rios 25 million ha with high erosion risk Jujuy TbD upon Project start up b Outside Project area 45 million hectares

In Chaco the provincial government has adopted the Projects technical guidelines to design forest management plans Disposición Nro 17215 as the base for applying the PES scheme to about 45 millón ha of forests categorized under the National Forest Protection Law In Formosa the Project has the commitment of the governamental authorities to replicate Projects lessons in its jurisdiction about 35 million ha of forests In Entre Ríos a bill to incorporate payment for carbon and biodiversity ES into the Provincial Conservation Law has been presented to the local Legislature covering about 2 million ha of soil under erosion risk In Misiones the Project has the commitment from the provincial government and several Watershed Committees about 60000 ha to replicate Projects lessons and snd PES design
Outside Pilot Areas i activities regarding development of Forest Conservation Indicators and Forest Management Plans have been initiated wint the province of La Pampa with a replication potencial in 25 millon ha of Calden forest ii The Project is participating into the SAyDS Program on Forest Managenment with Integrated Livestock PFMIL The PFMIL will be applied to about 12 million ha of forest in the Northern part of the country iii activities to replicate Projectlessons have been carried out capacitation workshops on SE and PES with two Watershed Committees in Misiones Province Jabotí and Tabay covering about 60000 ha

a In pilot Provinces Chaco 45 million ha of forests Formosa 35 million ha of forests Entre Rios 25 million ha with high erosion risk Jujuy TbD upon Project start up b Outside Project area 45 million hectares

In Chaco the provincial government has adopted the Projects technical guidelines to design forest management plans Disposición Nro 17215 as the base for applying the PES scheme to about 45 millón ha of forests categorized under the National Forest Protection Law In Formosa the Project has the commitment of the governamental authorities to replicate Projects lessons in its jurisdiction about 35 million ha of forests In Entre Ríos a bill to incorporate payment for carbon and biodiversity ES into the Provincial Conservation Law has been presented to the local Legislature covering about 2 million ha of soil under erosion risk In Misiones the Project has the commitment from the provincial government and several Watershed Committees about 60000 ha to replicate Projects lessons and snd PES design
Outside Pilot Areas i activities regarding development of Forest Conservation Indicators and Forest Management Plans have been initiated wint the province of La Pampa with a replication potencial in 25 millon ha of Calden forest ii The Project is participating into the SAyDS Program on Forest Managenment with Integrated Livestock PFMIL The PFMIL will be applied to about 12 million ha of forest in the Northern part of the country iii activities to replicate Projectlessons have been carried out capacitation workshops on SE and PES with two Watershed Committees in Misiones Province Jabotí and Tabay covering about 60000 ha

description.narrative: 3 increase in the composition of representative communities andor functional groups of the ecosystems in projects intervention area

comment.narrative: Information available at regional areas

Herbaceous and shrub species 10 and ground cover 15 tree seedlings 5 in species and 5 in abundance pollinating insects 10 in families predatory arthropods 10 in families birds 10 in species 5 for raptors and 5 for insectivores

Biodiversity baselines in the four Pilot Sites are completed Composition and abundance of different taxonomic groups ie vegetation mammals bats and birds have been established for the most representative ecological habitatscommunities in the four Pilot Sites Information from baseline will be used to estimate increase in the composition of representative communitiesfunctional groups at the end of Project after ES providers have made land use changes and adopted Projects prescribed conservation practices

Herbaceous and shrub species 10 and ground cover 15 tree seedlings 5 in species and 5 in abundance pollinating insects 10 in families predatory arthropods 10 in families birds 10 in species 5 for raptors and 5 for insectivores

description.narrative: 1Number of schemes and hectares under PES schemes in pilot areas

comment.narrative: No PES under implementation with differential payment reflecting amounts of ES provided
By end of project 4 PES schemes covering 145000 hectares

Four PES schemes for Chaco Formosa Entre Rios and Misiones have been designed and under different levels of implementation Total area covered by the four PES schemes is 85000 ha after correcting area in Misiones pilot site
By end of project 4 PES schemes covering 145000 hectares

Four PES schemes for Chaco Formosa Entre Rios and Misiones have been designed and under different levels of implementation Total area covered by the four PES schemes is 85000 ha after correcting area in Misiones pilot site

description.narrative: Provincial capacities strengthened to upscale pilot PES schemes to landscape levels
1Number of landowners willing to prepare management plans to participate in the PES scheme proposed by the project under the Forest and Soil laws

comment.narrative: By PY4 at least a total of 100 producers in Chaco Formosa and Entre Rios

41 landowners Chaco 27 Formosa 14 prepared and presented management plans to be elegible for receiving payment under National Forest Law in 2014 another 17 are in the process to do so 30 farmers in Entre Rios are involved in the planning process for the sistematization of their farms pending the approval of the bill to include compensation for carbon and biodiversity conservation into the Provincial Sil Conservation Law
By PY4 at least a total of 100 producers in Chaco Formosa and Entre Rios

41 landowners Chaco 27 Formosa 14 prepared and presented management plans to be elegible for receiving payment under National Forest Law in 2014 another 17 are in the process to do so 30 farmers in Entre Rios are involved in the planning process for the sistematization of their farms pending the approval of the bill to include compensation for carbon and biodiversity conservation into the Provincial Sil Conservation Law

description.narrative: 2Number of pilot Provinces that adjust their regulatory frameworks to enable upscaling of PES at provincial level

comment.narrative: By PY4 Jujuy and Entre Rios

Lagal frameworks being adjusted to enable upscaling at provincial levels are being carried out in Chaco Entre Ríos y Misiones In Chaco a regulation Disposición 1752015 has been passed to norm that management plans to be presented to receive compensation under Forest Conservation Law 26331 must be developed under the Project guidelines In Entre Rios a bill proposal based on Project developments to include compensation for carbon and biodiversity ES conservation into the Provincial Soil Conservation Law is under currently under discussion in the local Legislature In Misiones a study to adjust the existing legal framework for designing and executing PES scheme on water is currently underway in collaboration with the provincial government
By PY4 Jujuy and Entre Rios

Lagal frameworks being adjusted to enable upscaling at provincial levels are being carried out in Chaco Entre Ríos y Misiones In Chaco a regulation Disposición 1752015 has been passed to norm that management plans to be presented to receive compensation under Forest Conservation Law 26331 must be developed under the Project guidelines In Entre Rios a bill proposal based on Project developments to include compensation for carbon and biodiversity ES conservation into the Provincial Soil Conservation Law is under currently under discussion in the local Legislature In Misiones a study to adjust the existing legal framework for designing and executing PES scheme on water is currently underway in collaboration with the provincial government

description.narrative:
3Number of additional hectares in pilot provinces where PES schemes may be upscaled
Number of decision makers technical staff and auditors of provinces with capacities strengthened to provide oversight to upscaling of PES schemes

comment.narrative:
By PY4 at least 25 million hectares in ER 45 million hectares in Chaco and 35 million in Formosa Jujuy to be determined upon project startup
By PY4 at least 50 of staffs of relevant areas of the institutions involved

In Chaco steps are being taken by provincial authorities to upscale Project guidelines to 45 million ha In Formosa there is the commitment by provincial authorities to upscale Project guidelines to 35 million ha In Entre Ríos after the bill proposal to include compensation for carbón and biodiversity ES is passed the PES scheme will be upscaled to 25 million ha In Misiones activities for replicating Project lessons directed to upscaling to two watersheds are underway about 60000 ha
All relevant decisonmakers and staff from provincial governments in the four pilot sites related to the PES schemes are involved in PES design and upscaling Chaco 10 Formosa 7 Entre Ríos 5 Misiones 5
